subtitleNullable: Is Happiness important for Heart Health ?
descriptionNullable:
All data in this dataset has a UK Open Government Licence (OGL).

A [link](https://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/) to the OGL.

A [link](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NHS_Scotland) the National Health Service (NHS) Scotland Wikipedia page (Population, Health Board areas, etc).

**Is there a link between Coronary Heart Disease (CHD) and Happiness ?**

Cardiovascular diseases (CVDs) are the leading cause of death globally. [link](https://www.who.int/news-room/fact-sheets/detail/cardiovascular-diseases-(cvds))

**Heart disease mortality by health board dataset.**

I decided to focus on Coronary Heart Disease (CHD) because the other causes of death, heart failure and heart attack. 
Can occur without prior indication.

**Data Visualisations** 

[Link](http://rpubs.com/Paddy_5142/1083093) to a Markdown Document with code chunks to display charts, giving a view of the total number of Deaths from Heart Disease, in Scotland between 2012-2021.

The following links to spreadsheets, contain notes detailing my steps to final charts (with the exception of Chart 1).

**Chart 1** - Deaths in Scotland from (CHD), between 2012-2021. [link](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1P4FdDs7MMQjGzF5cAj9XR2MoqoOt8-ZBJ3AfcO-pmGY/edit?usp=sharing) 
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F13231939%2Fa6481b0350d1a42cbf5b35ce7ad897b9%2FScreenshot%202023-08-16%2013.45.09.png?generation=1692190053064554&alt=media) 

**Chart 2** - Deaths from CHD in 2012 in Ayrshire, Fife and Highlands. [link](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/18kksS0rTDwDoEpIE3LRRJ9F9Z943FKIQ-P0wTsANsds/edit?usp=sharing)
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F13231939%2F6e07330cc139187b8e22db1a77a59135%2FScreenshot%202023-08-16%2013.50.51.png?generation=1692190353037807&alt=media)

**Chart 3** - Deaths from CHD between 2012-2021 in Ayrshire, Fife and Highlands. [link](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1ZmKxHXOWIM1OnVOGdjBdZkRPCoHcppaUFxNOzHjfj5o/edit?usp=sharing)
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F13231939%2Fd49cb1e15270e320b4ab3520088ad8b3%2FScreenshot%202023-08-16%2013.53.44.png?generation=1692190513183909&alt=media)

**Chart 4** - Mean Happiness scores between 2012-2021 for Scotland, Ayrshire, Fife and Highlands. [link](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1wdyzHX21rSd8WFIYYxvCwO0y_A8lH6yx7wqT29WBCm8/edit?usp=sharing)
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F13231939%2F89717203a68f76317131944fe7c7bf08%2FScreenshot%202023-08-16%2013.56.26.png?generation=1692190668077175&alt=media)

**Chart 5** - Mean Anxiety scores between 2012-2021 for Scotland, Ayrshire, Fife and Highlands. [link](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Bw194ytVn7TF315vddsw4hLGRUB1JQKRkZmwSvm3usM/edit?usp=sharing)
![](https://www.googleapis.com/download/storage/v1/b/kaggle-user-content/o/inbox%2F13231939%2F9eae741efc46998ac4699d1597776d80%2FScreenshot%202023-08-16%2013.58.44.png?generation=1692190802372718&alt=media)

**Chart 1** -  More males than females died from CHD.

**Chart 2** - Age is a major factor in death from CHD.

**Chart 3** - Differences in deaths from CHD based on location.

**Chart 4** - Differences in mean happiness scores based on location.

**Chart 5** - Differences in mean anxiety scores based on location.

All the data used covers the same ten year period 2012-2021 (Scottish heart disease mortality by health board, Scottish mean happiness and anxiety scores by local authority area).
The decision to use the health boards of Ayrshire and Arran (labelled as only Ayrshire) Fife and Highlands was based on their similar populations (to compare deaths from CHD).
The mean value of the three local authority areas of Ayrshire (north, south and east), was used for comparison against the local authority areas of Fife and Highlands (in regard to mean happiness and anxiety scores).

The two most important factors to determine the risk of developing Coronary Heart Disease (CHD) are : *Age and Systolic blood pressure.*
So over time raised blood pressure or hypertension will probably lead to Coronary Heart Disease.


**Is there a correlation between anger and high blood pressure?**

Yes, there is a correlation between anger and high blood pressure. Anger can cause the release of stress hormones, such as adrenaline and cortisol, which can raise blood pressure. Anger can also cause the blood vessels to constrict, which can further raise blood pressure.
People who are angry or hostile tend to have higher blood pressure than those who are not. Anger can also cause blood pressure to spike temporarily, even in people who do not have hypertension.

Anger and stress can lead to unhealthy lifestyle choices, such as smoking, drinking, unhealthy eating, and lack of exercise. These unhealthy lifestyle choices can then lead to ill health, such as heart disease.
In addition, anger and stress can also lead to long-term negative mood patterns. These negative mood patterns can make it difficult to make healthy lifestyle choices and can also lead to further ill health.

It is likely that both happiness and lifestyle choices play a role in ill health. People who are happy are more likely to make healthy lifestyle choices, and people who make healthy lifestyle choices are more likely to be happy. However, it is difficult to say which factor is more important, as both happiness and lifestyle choices are complex and multifaceted.

**Can Happiness help your health ?**

Laughter can help to reduce stress, improve mood, and boost the immune system. It can also help to reduce pain and improve circulation.
Laughter is also a great way to connect with others and build relationships. It can help to create a sense of community and belonging.
Overall, laughter is a great way to improve your overall health and well-being. It is a natural and effective way to relieve stress, improve mood, and boost the immune system. [link](https://theheartfoundation.org/2019/06/24/5-reasons-you-should-laugh-everyday/#:~:text=Laughter%20has%20the%20same%20benefits,cholesterol%20and%20raises%20HDL%20cholesterol.)

**Is contentment a panacea ?**

Contentment is the feeling that you are happy with who you are and what you have; the roles you play in the world and the material acquisitions that you own. In some ways, external things can indeed make us happy and content at least for a while. Yet, they can never completely quench our insatiable craving for more power and possessions. This is mainly because contentment is a state of mind. [link](https://www.buddhistdoor.net/features/a-panacea-called-contentment/#:~:text=The%20Buddha%20said%2C%20%E2%80%9CContentment%20is,becoming%20an%20extremely%20rare%20commodity.)

**Conclusion.**

**There does seem to be a correlation between happiness and heart health:**
- In the Highlands local authority area, mean scores for happiness were higher than either Ayrshire or Fife and Scotland 2012-2021.
- Also in the Highlands local authority area, mean scores for anxiety were lower than either Ayrshire or Fife and Scotland 2012-2021.
- The number of deaths by CHD in the Highlands health board area (combined male and female), is lower than either Ayrshire or Fife       2012-2021.

*“Contentment is the greatest wealth.”* Buddha

*“A calm and modest life brings more happiness than the pursuit of success combined with constant restlessness.”* Albert Einstein


**Keep Happy!** 

Love: Sacred Elixir of the Heart.
Unravelling the Mysteries of Love. [link](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/patricklford/love-is-the-most-potent-elixir) *To my project on Kaggle.*

Immunity and the Connections of Mental Well Being.
The Power of Food to Strengthen the Immune System, to Protect Us. [link](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/patricklford/immunity-and-the-connections-of-mental-well-being) *To my project on Kaggle.*

Antidepressants: Bottled Sunshine ?
The Serotonin theory of Depression and Tryptophan Depletion. [link](https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/patricklford/antidepressant-usage-in-scandinavia-5-19yrs-old) *To my project on Kaggle.*

Patrick Ford 😊
title: Scottish Coronary Heart Disease 2012-2021
